name: Spotted Scat
description: It has a tall, flat body, silvery coloration, and numerous dark spots.
food_note: Plant parts, invertebrates, detritus (settled organic debris)
image_alt: Spotted Scat, photo: Tereza Mrhálková, Prague Zoo
reproduction: They lay eggs on stones, and both parents care for the offspring
attractions: It is a fish commonly kept in aquariums. It can adapt to fluctuating water salinity. Juveniles inhabit fresher waters before migrating to the sea. The front part of its dorsal fin has venomous spines that can cause painful injuries.
breeding: We have kept this species since 2004 in a brackish aquarium in the Indonesian Jungle Pavilion.
